meanings.sent1: She was so gullible that she believed the fake treasure map was real.
meanings.sent2: He is gullible and falls for scams easily.
meanings.sent3: The gullible puppy thought the toy squirrel was a real animal.
meanings.sent4: Her gullible nature made her an easy target for con artists.
meanings.sent5: The gullible child thought the magician's tricks were real magic.

meanings.definition: Naive and easily persuaded to believe something.
meanings.sent1: Being gullible, she trusted strangers too quickly.
meanings.sent2: The gullible tourist fell for the classic pickpocket distraction.
meanings.sent3: His gullible nature led him to believe in talking animals.
meanings.sent4: The gullible student thought the internet rumor was a fact.
meanings.sent5: The gullible audience believed the exaggerated claims of the infomercial.
